items.text: full outside off stump, and takes a lot of bounce through to the gloves of the keeper
items.shortText: Malinga to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: chipped to mid on, and dropped by Mathews! Ten marks for the effort, but that doesn't get you a wicket. Full on middle and leg, and the batsman tried to work this towards midwicket. Takes a leading edge, and lobs straight towards mid on, but Mathews dives forward and keep complete the catch
items.shortText: Malinga to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: full just outside off, and defended off the front foot to cover. Again the outswing taking the ball towards the off side
items.shortText: Malinga to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: good length outside off stump, and he splices a punch down to cover point
items.shortText: Malinga to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: slower ball, but it's slipped off his hand! Goes down the leg side, but almost comes to the batsman at waist height. The umpire calls it a wide
items.shortText: Malinga to Mohammad Mithun, 1 wide

items.text: full toss on middle stump, and he top-edges a leg-side slog down to fine leg. The fielder gets to the ball, but it's once again a dropped chance. He was diving forward, and the ball popped out. But the umpire calls it a no-ball for height. Free hit coming up
items.shortText: Malinga to Mohammad Mithun, (no ball) 1 run

items.text: taken by Mathews at mid on! But it's off a free hit. Malinga goes short, and Mushfiqur's attempted pull is top-edged to mid on. The batsmen are safe, and they even manage to pinch a single
items.postText: Gnanaguru: "Looks like Anderson and Broad vs Indians"
items.shortText: Malinga to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: back of a length outside off, and angling into the batsman's body. Mushi covers his off stump and then shoulders his arms
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: full just outside off, and he walks forward to defend. Crisply hit to cover
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: good length on off, and defended off the back foot to square leg. Calls early and takes off for a quick single
items.postText: Raj Patel: "5 overs up and not even a single boundary scored. Quiet rare in the modern day cricket"
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.preText: Sreekar: "Isn't this a batting pitch with few cracks and no grass?" -- haha, pitch reports are often like weather reports. But to be fair to the Sri Lankans, they've been excellent with the ball. Not so good in the field though.
items.text: back of a length ball, and angling into his body. He lifts his front leg and then pulls this square to the fielder in the deep
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: tight from Lakmal. Length ball just outside off stump, and left alone by the batsman
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: full on off, and aimed at the stumps. Forces Mushfiqur to play at it, and he carefully defends off the front foot. Another great over from Lakmal
items.postText: DA: "Can't blame Malinga for not getting wickets like he used to,if fielders aren't ready to catch the balls. Even with his pot belly he's creating chances, like he has been doing everytime he gets a chance to play for SL. Seems like the only way he's going to take wickets today is if bowls players out or get LBWs. "
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.preText: Arzoo : "Any update on Tamim? Is he going to be able to bat again?" -- We're trying to find out! Rest assured, you'll be the first to know.
items.text: full on off, and he comes forward to defend. Off the bat's middle, but the ball dribbles away straight to the fielder at cover
items.shortText: Malinga to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: full outside off, and swinging further away. Plays it late, waiting for he ball the crease-area, before attempting a square drive to the off side
items.shortText: Malinga to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: full on off, and this was the inswinger from Malinga! He clips this off his pads to the leg side, but it finds the fielder at midwicket. It's a misfield, so Mithun wants the single, but his senior partner yells out 'no'
items.shortText: Malinga to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: good length on off, and he closes his bat to nudge this behind square off his pads. Stopped by Dilruwan at square leg
items.postText: Awais: "@DA. totally agreed. Sarfaraz ahmad was dropped twice of his bowling that costed SL the match nd rewarded Pakistan THE CHAMPIONS TROPHY. "
items.shortText: Malinga to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: fuller on off stump, and that's been caressed through the midwicket region. Mathews - from mid on - must give it a chase, and Bangladesh only settle for two runs. There was three written all over that shot
items.postText: Nirosh: "Is there anyway to know what pace Malinga is bowling. Got his pace back? " -- it says 137-140 on an average, but I never trust these speed guns
items.shortText: Malinga to Mohammad Mithun, 2 runs

items.text: full on off stump, and he comes forward to drive with the closed bat once again. Struck firmly towards the right of mid on, and that allows the batsmen to scamper across for one
items.shortText: Malinga to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: good length outside off, and he checks a cut shot past the fielder at point. Malinga cleans up at third man
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.preText: Syed Naqvi: "Asia cup in UAE without home team. Too much politics in cricket these days." -- Agree with the second sentence, but UAE lost the chance to qualify after they lost to Hong Kong in the Asia Cup qualifiers
items.text: back of a length on off, and cramping Mushi for room. He flat-bats an attempted pull down to mid on
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: good length outside off, and he goes for an expansive square cut. Mistimed to cover point
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: full outside off stump, and swinging away from the batsman. Driven with the angled bat, but goes straight to the fielder at cover
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: good length outside off, but angling into the batsman this time. He goes onto the back foot, and taps this to point
items.postText: Lasan Rashmika: "Why Mushfiqur Rahim playing a test innings? " -- come on, man! He's trying to rebuild, as any smart cricketer should at this stage.
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: first boundary! Took Bangladesh 48 balls to get that. Full and on his pads, and Mushi has no trouble whipping this square onto the leg side
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mushfiqur Rahim, FOUR runs
